Today was the official launch of Quotient’s Charity of the Year for 2017-18 - The Alzheimer’s Society @alzheimerssoc 
Our new charity was selected by our employees, following a company-wide nomination and voting process. It is close to many people’s hearts and we are all keen to unite our efforts in raising donations to fund research that will eventually find a cure
.
#UniteAgainstDementia #charity #fundraising #research #help #support #dementia #alzheimers

LET ME INTRODUCE YOU – Igor Smirnov has become a VanGoghle member and we’re pleased to have his work in our gallery. ⠀
Igor Smirnov (1975) is a versatile painter. His paintings are monumental, mostly in large format, and feature complicated structures. The artist tries to get into his mind, as if it were a neurological research. During the process of painting. his hand works together with his brains, resulting in almost impossible representations, which are related to the enlargement of the inward cosmos.⠀
⠀
A great selection of his work is available in our shop. [Link in bio]⠀
#igorsmirnov #structures #oilpaint #imagination #research #vangoghle ⠀

Photo: Eugene Kitsios @eugenekitsios via Dr. Tristan Guttridge @tristanguttridge • 'A lot of love out there for sharks but often the nurse shark gets sidelined....This is a wonderful close-up of the sensory apparatus of this species - note the large nostrils (nares) each capable of detecting chemical cues independent of each other and of course the dangling barbels that likely serve a tactile function, sensing changes in surface textures! Nurse sharks use Bimini's waters year-round but the next couple of months are particularly important for reproduction --- lots of mating pairs in the shallows ! Great time to be a nurse shark.' •

#bimini #sharklab #bahamas #shark #science #research #nose #nurseshark #closeup #elasmobranch #barbel

With two suns in its sky, Luke Skywalker's home planet Tatooine in "Star Wars" looks like a parched, sandy desert world. In real life, thanks to observatories such as NASA's Kepler space telescope, we know that two-star systems can indeed support planets, although planets discovered so far around double-star systems are large and gaseous. Scientists wondered: If an Earth-size planet were orbiting two suns, could it support life? It turns out, such a planet could be quite hospitable if located at the right distance from its two stars, and wouldn't necessarily even have deserts. In a particular range of distances from two sun-like host stars, a planet covered in water would remain habitable and retain its water for a long time, according to a new study in the journal Nature Communications.
📸: @nasa
#science #nasa #space #tatooine #planet#exoplanet #doublesun #research #planets

Hip Strategy
----------
Want to lessen your risk for injury when performing sport-related tasks such as landing or cutting?
. 
Learning to implement a 'hip strategy' when decelerating is thought to be an effective technique for taking advantage of the force generating capability of the large hip extensors (glutes) and knee extensors (quads) and decreasing overall stress to passive subsystem structures such as ligaments, cartilage and bone.
.
The hip strategy consists of three elements, which are depicted nicely in this video.
1️⃣ Flex the trunk
2️⃣ Flex the hips
3️⃣Avoid excessive anterior knee migration .
All of these strategies will help encourage force attenuation by the neuromuscular system and reduce injury risk and/or the development of pain.
.
.
.
#rehab #pain #biomechanics #physicaltherapy #glutes #muscle #strength #exercise #movement #fitness #health #volleyball #basketball #soccer #acl #knee #science #research #sports #injury #injuryprevention #kinesiology #orthopedics #sportsmedicine #sportsrehab #strengthtraining #gymnastics #sport #athlete

Metamaterials are materials whose function is determined by structure, not composition. They have been designed to bend light and sound, transform from soft to stiff, and even dampen seismic waves from earthquakes. But each of these functions requires a unique mechanical structure, making these materials great for specific tasks, but difficult to implement broadly. 
Harvard researchers have developed a general framework to design reconfigurable metamaterials. The design strategy is scale independent, meaning it can be applied to everything from meter-scale architectures to reconfigurable nano-scale systems such as photonic crystals, waveguides and metamaterials to guide heat.

You can find out more, including links to the full-length videos, on our Facebook page www.facebook.com/wevolver 
#design #engineering #research #materials #innovation #technology

Follow @sharktagging to see shark research in action and discover news facts about sharks! @sharktagging The SRC team releases a male bull shark with one of our satellite tags attached to its dorsal fin. Every time the tag's antenna breaks the surface, it's position is transmitted to a satellite that sends our team the shark's location in near real-time! Tracking this species has shown us they exhibit high site fidelity, with a preference for shallow water habitats near the coast. You can follow the movements of our satellite tagged sharks on our website, or click the link in @sharktagging's bio to adopt your own and follow its travels around the Atlantic! Awesome video by Josh Liberman (@joshlibermanphotography).
•••

One more reason to love elephants: They might help us cure cancer! A research team is looking at the genome of the African elephant for changes in oncogenes and tumour suppressor genes. Oncogenes can cause cells to grow out of control while tumour suppressor genes slow down cell division. These are the two main types of genes that play a role in cancer and could help explain potential mechanisms of cancer resistance in elephants

@robbielab

Science and knowledge have the power to bring people together. 
UNESCO is proud to participate in the SESAME project, an example of science diplomacy at its best in which representatives of Cyprus, Egypt, Iran, Israel, Jordan, Pakistan, the Palestinian Authority and Turkey have worked together to build a synchrotron light source. Finally opened today in Allan (Jordan), SESAME is expected to boost research and scientific cooperation in the Middle East across inter-regional divides. 
#SESAME #Science #Science4Peace #Dialogue #ScienceDiplomacy #Diplomacy #UNESCO #Development #Cooperation #Research
